# CPSC334

This folder holds the materials for CPSC334: Creative Embedded System, as it will be taught at Yale, Fall 2020.

The 'Syllabus' directory holds the syllabus

The 'Modules' directory holds all of our original textual and visual material that we develop for the class.

The 'External_Resources' directory holds external resources that are used during the class.
These will be at times references by Modules.
External resources can include documentation, texts, links, audio, video, setup scripts, etc

# Generating HTML

This folder can also be used to generate a website of the content using https://www.npmjs.com/package/markdown-folder-to-html

# Week 1

The goal of this project is to familiarize yourself with the use of embedded systems for artistic purposes.

This project focuses on the following system configuration. 

              |------|
    D_in ---> |  Pi  | ---> D_out
              |------|  


This is the simplest system we will address this semester - a microcomputer with digital out.
You have two options for digital out - either visual or audio.


# Live Coding 

In our taxonomy of systems, we have the keyboard and D_in and audio or visuals as D_out.

## Audio 

Your raspberry pi comes pre-installed with a program called Sonic Pi.
We will start exploring the practice of live coding with this tool.

## Visuals

Live coding for visuals is also an active space of exploration.
For visuals, we will use Hydra (?)

# Installation Art


## Audio

## Interactivity

Some, but not all, installation art will rely on input from the viewer.
The viewer may contribute to the art knowingly or unknowingly - actively or passively.
We will not draw a formal distinction between these two types of input as, from a technical perspective, we must solve similar issues.
